tit.j: ウメ

sen.j: ウメ（梅、学名：Prunus mume）は、バラ科サクラ属の落葉高木、またはその果実のこと。
sen.e: Japanese plum (binomial name: Prunus Mume) is a deciduous tall tree of Rosaceae Prunusor or its fruits.
Japanese plum (technical name: Prunus Mume) refers to a deciduous tall tree of Rosaceae Prunusor or its fruits.
sen.cmt: binomial > technical. Is a > refers to a.
sen.e: Japanese plum (technical name: Prunus Mume) refers to a deciduous tall tree of Rosaceae Prunusor or its fruits.

tit.j: 概要

sen.j: 別名に好文木（こうぶんぼく）、春告草（はるつげぐさ）、木の花（このはな）、初名草（はつなぐさ）、香散見草（かざみぐさ）、風待草（かぜまちぐさ）、匂草（においぐさ）などがある。
sen.e: Another Japanese names include Kobunboku, Harutsugegusa, Konohana, Hatsunagusa, Kazamigusa, Kazemachigusa and Nioigusa.
Other Japanese names include Kobunboku, Harutsugegusa, Konohana, Hatsunagusa, Kazamigusa, Kazemachigusa and Nioigusa.
Other Japanese names include Kobunboku, Harutsugegusa, Konohana, Hatsunagusa, Kazamigusa, Kazemachigusa and Nioigusa.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降、花見といえばサクラということになっている。
sen.e: After the Edo period, Hanami (flower viewing) is associated with cherry blossom.
Since the Edo period, Hanami (flower viewing) has come to be associated with cherry blossoms.
sen.cmt: after > since. Is > has come to be. Blossom > blossoms.
sen.e: Since the Edo period, Hanami (flower viewing) has come to be associated with cherry blossoms.

sen.j: しかし奈良時代以前に「花」といえば、むしろ梅を指すことの方が多かった。
sen.e: Before the Nara period, however, when people referred to flower, they almost always meant Japanese plum.
Before the Nara period, however, when people referred to 'flowers', they almost always meant Japanese plum.
Before the Nara period, however, when people referred to 'flowers', they almost always meant Japanese plum.

sen.j: 梅が次第に桜によって駆逐されはじめるのは、平安時代中頃からのことである。
sen.e: Around the mid Heian period, Japanese plum came to be driven out by cherry blossom.
Around the mid Heian period, Japanese plums came to be endangered by the presence of cherry blossoms.
sen.cmt: driven out > endangered by the presence.
sen.e: Around the mid Heian period, Japanese plums came to be endangered by the presence of cherry blossoms.

sen.j: 天文 (日本)14年（1545年）4月17日 (旧暦)に当時の天皇が、京都の賀茂神社に梅を奉納したと『御湯殿上日記』にある。
sen.e: As it is written in "Oyudono no ue no Nikki" that on April 17, 1545, the emperor of that time dedicated Japanese plums to Kamo-jinja Shine in Kyoto, the 'Kishu ume no kai" (Kishu Japanese plum's association) set June 6 as the Japanese plum day.
It is written in "Oyudono no ue no Nikki" that on April 17 (of the old Calendar), 1545, the Emperor of the time made an offering of Japanese plums to Kamo-jinja Shine in Kyoto,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is written in 'Diary of the Ladies-in-Waiting' (Oyudono no ue no Nikki) that on April 17, 1545 (in the lunar calendar), the Emperor of that time made an offering of Japanese plums to Kamo-jinja Shine in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: ピリオドにしました。御湯殿上日記に説明を加えました。

sen.j: それにちなみ、「紀州梅の会」が新暦の6月6日を梅の日に定めている。
sen.e: Based on this, the 'Kishu ume no kai" (Kishu Japanese plum's association) set June 6 as the Japanese plum day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Based on this, the 'Kishu Japanese Plum's Association' set June 6 as the Japanese plum day.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 特徴および品種
sen.e: Characteristics and variety
Characteristics and variety
Characteristics and variety

sen.j: アンズの近縁種であり、容易に交雑する。
sen.e: It is related species of apricot and crosses easily.
It is closely related to the apricot and crossbreeds easily.
sen.cmt: related species > closely related. Crosses> crossbreeds.
sen.e: It is closely related to the apricot and crossbreeds easily.

sen.j: 野梅系（やばいけい）の果実は小型であり、果実を利用する豊後系（ぶんごけい）（肥後系（ひごけい）とも呼ばれる）ではアンズとの交雑により大型化している。
sen.e: Fruits of Yabaikei (one kind of Japanese plum) are small but those of Bungokei (another kind) (or Higokei), which are edible, are larger by intercrossing with apricot.
Fruits of Yabaikei (one kind of Japanese plum) are small in size but the edible Bungokei or Higokei species have become larger through crossbreeding with the apricot.
sen.cmt: small > small in size. Intercrossing > crossbreeding.
sen.e: Fruits of the Yabai line are small in size but the edible species of the Bungo line (also called the Higo line) have become larger through crossbreeding with the apricot.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: ただし、完熟しても果肉に甘味を生じることはない。
sen.e: However, the fruits are not sweet even if they are completely ripe.
However, the fruits are not sweet even if they are completely ripe.
However, the fruits are not sweet even if they are completely ripe.

sen.j: 花芽はモモと異なり、一節につき1個となるため、モモに比べ、開花時の華やかな印象は薄い。
sen.e: Different from peach, as Japanese plum has one flower per flower bud, it looks less gorgeous than peach at the time of bloom.
As the Japanese plum only has one flower per bud, it appears less flamboyant than the peach when it blooms.
As the Japanese plum only has one flower per bud, it appears less flamboyant than the peach when it blooms.

sen.j: 毎年2月から4月に5枚の花弁のある1センチメートルから3センチメートルほどの花を葉に先立って咲かせる。
sen.e: During every February to April, the Japanese plum tree produces 1 to 3centimeter flowers with five petals ahead of leaves.
Every February to April, before growing leaves the Japanese plum tree produces 1-3 centimeter flowers with five petals.
sen.cmt: during X. ahead of leaves > before growing leaves.
sen.e: Every February to April, before growing leaves the Japanese plum tree produces 1-3 centimeter flowers with five petals.

sen.j: 花の色は白、またはピンクから赤。
sen.e: The flower is white or in a color between pink and red.
The flower is white or a pinky red.
sen.cmt: between pink and red > a pinky red.
sen.e: The flower is white or a pinky red.

sen.j: 葉は互生で先がとがった卵形で、周囲が鋸歯状。
sen.e: It has alternate leaves, which are acute and serrate-sided in egg shape.
It has alternate egg-shaped leaves with serrated edges.
It has alternate egg-shaped leaves with serrated edges.

sen.j: 果実は2センチメートルから3センチメートルのほぼ球形の核果でみの片側に浅い溝がある。
sen.e: The plum is a 2 to 3centimeter stone fruit in almost spherical shape, which is scrobiculated in one side.
The plum is a 2-3 centimeter spherical fruit with a stone and an indent on one side.
sen.cmt: stone > with a stone. Spherical shape > spherical. Scrobiculated > indent.
sen.e: The plum is a 2-3 centimeter spherical fruit with a stone and an indent on one side.

sen.j: 6月頃に黄色く熟す。
sen.e: Japanese plum matures in yellow around June.
It ripens into a yellow shade around June.
sen.cmt: matures > ripens in yellow > into a yellow shade.
sen.e: It ripens into a yellow shade around June.

sen.j: 七十二候の芒種末候には「梅子黄（梅の実が黄ばんで熟す）」と、ある。
sen.e: It is written in Boshu Makko in Shichijuniko (72 divisions of the solar year) that 'the fruits of the Japanese plum trees mature in yellow.'
sen.cmt: 芒種末候→定訳不明です。
sen.e: It is written in Boshu Makko in Shichijuniko (72 divisions of the solar year) that 'the fruit of the Japanese plum trees ripen yellow.'
It is written in Boshu Makko in Shichijuniko (72 divisions of the solar year) that 'the fruit of the Japanese plum trees ripen yellow.'

sen.j: 梅には300種以上の品種があり、野梅系、紅梅系、豊後系の3系統に分類される。
sen.e: There are more than 300 different kinds of Japanese plum trees, which are classified in to three kinds: Yabaikei, Kobaikei and Bungokei.
There are more than 300 different kinds of Japanese plum trees, which are classified in to three kinds: Yabaikei, Kobaikei and Bungokei.
There are more than 300 different kinds of Japanese plum trees, which are classified in to three lines: the Yabai, the Kobai and the Bungo.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 梅の実を採るのは主に豊後系である。
sen.e: The fruits for edible use is mainly Bungokei plum trees.
The edible fruit mainly comes from the Bungokei plum trees.
sen.cmt: for edible use > edible fruits. Is > comes from
sen.e: The edible fruit mainly comes from the Bungo line plum trees.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

tit.j: 果実
薬効と毒性

sen.j: 花を観賞するほか、果実を梅干し、梅酒、梅酢やジャムなどにして食用とする。
sen.e: People view the flowers and the plums are eaten as Umeboshi (pickled plum), plum liquor, plum vinegar, plum jam, etc.
Whilst the flowers are valued for their aesthetic value, the plums are eaten as Umeboshi (pickled plums), plum liquor, plum vinegar, plum jam, etc.
sen.cmt: people view the > are valued for their aesthetic value.
sen.e: Whilst the flowers are valued for their aesthetic value, the plums are eaten as Umeboshi (pickled plums), plum liquor, plum vinegar, plum jam, etc.

sen.j: また甘露梅やのし梅などの菓子や、梅肉煮などの料理にも用いられる。
sen.e: The plums also used for Japanese sweets, such as Kanrobai (plums stewed in syrup) and Noshiume (a thin solid jelly consisting sweet plum jam) and for Japanese dishes, like braised fish with dried plum.

The plums are also used for Japanese sweets, such as Kanrobai (plums stewed in syrup) and Noshiume (a thin solid jelly consisting of sweet plum jam) and for Japanese dishes, like braised fish with dried plum.

The plums are also used for Japanese sweets, such as Kanrobai (plums stewed in syrup) and Noshiume (a thin solid jelly consisting of sweet plum jam) and for Japanese dishes, like braised fish with dried plum.

sen.j: 漢方薬では燻蒸（くんじょう）して真っ黒になった実を烏梅（うばい）といい、健胃、整腸、駆虫、止血、強心作用があるといわれる。
sen.e: As a Chinese herbal drug, the Japanese plum that is burnt black by fumigation is called Ubai and is believed to have stomachic action, intestinal regulation action, anthelmintic action, hemostatic action and cardiac action.

As a Chinese herbal drug, Japanese plums blackened by smoking are called Ubai and are believed to have effects on the stomach, regulation of intestines, as insecticide, for haemostatis and cardiac issues.
As a Chinese herbal drug, Japanese plums blackened by smoking are called Ubai and are believed to have effects of calming gastric and intestinal disorders, vermifuge, haemostatis and cardiotonic.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 中国では話梅（広東語 ワームイ）と呼ばれる干して甘味を付けた梅が菓子として売られている。
sen.e: In China, sweet dried plum called Wamui is sold as a Chinese confectionery.
In China, sweet dried plums called Wamui are sold as Chinese confectionery.
In China, sweet dried plums called Wamui are sold as Chinese confectionery.

sen.j: バラ科の葉や未成熟の青い果実、核の中の種子には青酸配糖体が含まれ、未熟な種子や腸内細菌の酵素により、シアン化物を生成する。
sen.e: Leaves, immature green plums and seeds in the nucleus of Rosaceae contain cyanogenetic glycoside and formulate cyanide by enzyme of immature seeds and bacterium flora in the intestine.

Leaves, immature green plums and seeds in the nucleus of Rosaceae contain cyanogenetic glycoside, thus cyanide can be produced by the reaction of immature seeds and bacterium flora with enzymes in the human intestine.
sen.cmt: and > thus. Formulate > can be produced by the reaction.
sen.e: Leaves, immature green plums and seeds in the nucleus of Rosaceae contain cyanogenetic glycoside, thus cyanide can be produced by immature seeds and enzymes of bacterium flora in the human intestine.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: これが胃酸によりシアン化水素毒性を発揮すると、痙攣や呼吸困難、さらには麻痺状態になって死亡するといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that if this causes hydrogen cyanide toxicity by gastric acid, people will develop spasticity and breathing difficulties and die from paralysis.
It is said that if this causes hydrogen cyanide toxicity by gastric acid, people can develop spasticity and breathing difficulties and die from paralysis.
It is said that if gastric acid causes hydrogen cyanide toxicity, people can develop spasticity, difficulty in breathing, and in the worst case die from paralysis.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: シアンの生成は胃酸や胃の消化酵素によるものではないので、大量の種子をかみ砕いた場合を除いて誤摂取による中毒の危険は限られる。
sen.e: As cyanide formation is not by stomach acid and digestive enzyme in the stomach, except crunching large amounts of seeds, it poses a limited risk to poisoning by accidental ingestion.
As cyanide cannot be formed by acid and digestive enzymes in the stomach (except in the case of large quantities of seeds), they pose only a very limited risk of poisoning by accidental ingestion.
As cyanide cannot be formed by acid and digestive enzymes in the stomach, the risk of poisoning by accidental intake is limited to the cases where large quantities of seeds are crunched.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: アンズの種子による重症例がある一方、幼児が青梅の果肉を囓った程度では心配ないとされる。
sen.e: While apricot seeds cause severe cases, it is safe for infants to gnaw Japanese green plums.
While apricot seeds can cause severe incidents, it is safe for infants to consume Japanese green plums.
While apricot seeds can cause severe incidents, it is safe for infants to nibble Japanese green plums.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: また、梅酒の青い実や梅干しの種の中身などは、アルコールや熱により酵素が失活し、毒性は低下している。
sen.e: Also, in case of green plums in plum liquor and inside of the seed of Umeboshi, alcohol and heat reduce the toxicity.
Also, in the case of green plums and pickled plum seeds contained in plum liquor, the toxicity is reduced by alcohol and heat.
sen.cmt: inside of the seed of Umeboshi > dried plum seeds.
sen.e: Also, in the case of green plums and dried plum seeds contained in plum liquor, the toxicity is reduced because alcohol and heat have inactivated enzymes.
sen.cmt: 酵素が失活の部分を補足しました。

sen.j: クエン酸をはじめとする有機酸などを多く含むので健康食品としても販売されている。
sen.e: As it contains a lot of organic acids, including citric acid, it is also sold as a health food.
As it contains a lot of natural acids, in particular citric acid, it is also sold as a health food.
As it contains a lot of organic acids, in particular citric acid, it is also sold as a health food.
sen.cmt: 有機酸をorganic acidとしました。

tit.j: 日本における作付けと収穫

sen.j: 農林水産省が平成20年（2008年）11月に公表した統計によると、日本全国で作付面積は1万7400ヘクタール、収穫量は12万2000トン、出荷量は10万3600トンである。
sen.e: According to the statistics released by Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries in November 2008, its cropping acreage was 17,400 hectares, its harvest

According to statistics released by Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries in November 2008, its cropping acreage was 17,400 hectares, its total harvest was 122,000 tons, the total shipped was 103,600 tons.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to statistics released by Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries in November 2008, its cropping acreage was 17,400 hectares, its total harvest 122,000 tons, and the total shipment 103,600 tons.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 収穫量の都道府県別では、北から青森 1930トン、群馬 6800トン、福井 1270トン、山梨 2100トン、長野 1990トン、奈良 2020トン、和歌山 6万7600トン、徳島 822トンである。
sen.e: By region, the total harvest was 1930 tons from the Northern peak of Japan to Aomori, 6800 tons in Gunma, 1270 in Fukui, 2100 tons in Yamanashi, 1990 tons in Nagano, 2020 tons in Nagano, 67,600 tons in Wakayama and 822 tons in Tokushima.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The total harvests by the region from the north were 1,930 tons in Aomori, 6,800 tons in Gunma, 1,270 tons in Fukui, 2,100 tons in Yamanashi, 1,990 tons in Nagano, 2,020 tons in Nara, 67,600 tons in Wakayama and 822 tons in Tokushima.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

tit.j: 語源

sen.j: 「ウメ」の語源には諸説ある。
sen.e: There are various stories about the origin of 'ume.'
There are various stories about the origin of 'ume.'
There are various stories about the origin of 'ume.'

sen.j: ウメには大きな薬効があるため、「ｕ(見たこともない)+ｍｅ(本当に大切な)」でウメと呼ばれた。
sen.e: As the plums have significant medical benefits, from the combination of 'u (never-seen-before) and me (truly-important)', it is named ume.
As the plums have significant medical benefits, it may be named Ume after the combination of 'u (never-seen-before) and me (truly-important)'.
sen.cmt: it is named > it may be named.
sen.e: As the plums have significant medical benefits, it may be named Ume after the combination of 'u (never-seen-before) and me (truly-important).'

sen.j: 中国語の「梅」（マイあるいはメイ）。
sen.e: It is also believed to be derived from '梅' in Chinese (mai/mei).
It is also believed to be derived from '梅' in Chinese (mai/mei).
It is also believed to be derived from '梅' in Chinese (mai/mei).

sen.j: 伝来当時の日本人は、鼻音の前に軽い鼻音を重ねていた（現在も東北方言などにその名残りがある）ため、meを/mme/（ンメ）のように発音していた。
sen.e: As Japanese people of the time of introduction reduplicated a light nasal sound before a nasal sound (this vestige remains in the Tohoku dialect today), they pronounced me as mme (ンメ).
As Japanese people of the time of introduction inserted a light nasal sound before n and m, (this vestige remains in the Tohoku dialect today), they pronounced mei as nme.
Japanese pronounciation at that time of introduction inserted a light nasal sound before n and m, (this vestige still remains in the Tohoku dialect today), and they pronounced mei as nme.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: これが「ムメ」のように表記され、さらに読まれることで/mume/となり/ume/へと転訛する。
sen.e: This was written as 'ンメ' and changed to mume and to ume over time.
This was written as 'ンメ' (nme) and changed to mume and to ume over time.
This was written as 'ンメ' (nme) and changed to mume and to ume over time.

sen.j: 一方で、今も「ンメ」のように発音する方言もまた残っている。
sen.e: At the same time, ume is still pronounced as mme in some dialects.
At the same time, ume is still pronounced as mme in some dialects.
At the same time, ume is still pronounced as mme in some dialects.

sen.j: ただし/ume/が先にあって、唇音の/u/が次にくる唇音の/m/に同化 (音声学)する音韻過程により/mme/へと変化したとする説も存在する。
sen.e: However, there is a theory that as the labial sound u was assimilated into the subsequent labial sound m, it changed to mme.
However, there is a theory that as the labial sound u was assimilated into the subsequent labial sound m, it changed to mme.
However, there is a theory that as the labial sound u was assimilated into the subsequent labial sound m, which changed to mme.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 他にも幾つかの異説があり、現在のところ、どれもまだ定説となるには至っていない。
sen.e: There are several other theories but none of them have become an established theory so far.
There are several other theories but none of them have become an established theory so far.
There are several other theories but none of them has become an established theory so far.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

tit.j: 家紋

sen.j: 梅紋（うめもん）は、ウメの花を図案化した日本の家紋である。
sen.e: ume-mon is a Japanese crest designed based on the Japanese plum flower.
Ume-mon is a Japanese crest designed based on the Japanese plum flower.
sen.cmt: 文頭を大文字にしました。
sen.e: Ume-mon is a Japanese crest designed based on the Japanese plum flower.

sen.j: その一種で「梅鉢（うめばち）」と呼ばれるものは、中心から放射線状に配置した花弁が太鼓の撥に似ていることに由来している。
sen.e: One of them called Umebachi originated from the fact that petals arranged in radiation order resembles drumsticks.
One type of crest called Umebachi was inspired by the spiral pattern of petals which resembles drumsticks.
One type of crest called Umebachi was inspired by the spiral pattern of petals which resembles drumsticks (bachi in Japanese).
sen.cmt: 鉢の由来がわかるように説明を補足しました。

sen.j: 奈良時代に模様として用いられはじめ、菅原道真が梅の花を好んだことにより天満宮の神紋として用いられ始めたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is believed that Umebachi came to be used as a pattern in the Nara period and as SUGAWARA no Michizane loved Japanese plum flowers, it was used as a crest for a shrine of Tenman-gu Shrine.
It is believed that Umebachi came to be used as a pattern in the Nara period and as SUGAWARA no Michizane loved Japanese plum flowers, it was used as the crest for a section Tenman-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: a crest > the crest. shrine > section.
sen.e: It is believed that Umebachi came to be used as a pattern in the Nara period and as SUGAWARA no Michizane loved Japanese plum flowers, it was used as the crest of Tenman-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 図案
sen.e: Design
Design
Design

sen.j: 図案は、「梅（うめ）」、「梅鉢（うめばち）」、「捻じ梅（ねじうめ）」、「実梅鉢（みうめばち）」などがある。
sen.e: Crest designs include 'ume,' 'umebachi,' 'neziume' and 'miumebachi.'
Crest designs include 'ume,' 'umebachi,' 'neziume' and 'miumebachi.'
Crest designs include 'ume,' 'umebachi,' 'neziume' and 'miumebachi.'

sen.j: 「匂い梅（においうめ）」や「向う梅（むこううめ）」などの写実的な図案の梅花紋と、「梅鉢」などの簡略的な図案の梅鉢紋に大別される。
sen.e: The designs are divided broadly into two types: photographed design, such as 'nioiume' and 'mukoue,' and simplified one, such as 'umebachi.'
The designs are divided broadly into two types: realistic design, such as 'nioiume' and 'mukoue,' and simplified ones, such as 'umebachi.'
The designs are divided broadly into two types: realistic design, such as 'nioiume' and 'mukoue,' and simplified ones, such as 'umebachi.'

sen.j: 使用
sen.e: Usage
Usage
Usage

sen.j: 「梅」は、太宰府天満宮、「星梅鉢」は北野天満宮が用いている。
sen.e: The 'ume' crest is used in Dazaifu Tenman-gu Shrine and the 'hoshi umebachi' crest is used in Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine.
The 'ume' crest is used in Dazaifu Tenman-gu Shrine and the 'hoshi umebachi' crest is used in Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine.
The 'ume' crest is used in Dazaifu Tenman-gu Shrine and the 'hoshi umebachi' crest is used in Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine.
sen.cmt: スペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 武家では、菅原氏の末裔や美濃斉藤氏の一族が菅原天神信仰に基づいて用いた。
sen.e: Among sumurai families, the descendant of the Sugawara clan and families of the Mino Saito clan use it based on Tenjin shrine faith (SUGAWARA no Michizane).
Among samurai families, the descendants of the Sugawara clan and families of the Mino Saito clan used it following the SUGAWARA Tenjin shrine faith.
Among samurai families, the descendants of the Sugawara clan and families of the Mino Saito clan used it following the SUGAWARA Tenjin shrine faith.

sen.j: 主に、加賀前田氏の「加賀梅鉢」や相良氏の「相良梅鉢」などがある。
sen.e: Mainly there are 'Kaga umebachi' crest of the Kaga Maeda clan, 'Sagara umebachi' crest of the Sagara clan, etc.
The main crests include are 'Kaga umebachi' of the Kaga Maeda clan and 'Sagara umebachi' crest of the Sagara clan, etc.
sen.cmt: main there are > the main crests include
sen.e: The main crests include 'Kaga umebachi' of the Kaga Maeda clan and 'Sagara umebachi' crest of the Sagara clan, etc.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

tit.j: ウメにまつわる言葉

sen.j: 「桜伐（き）る馬鹿、梅伐らぬ馬鹿」
sen.e: The fool who prunes cherry trees, and the fool who doesn't trim apricot trees.'
Anyone who prunes cherry trees is a fool, as is anyone who doesn't trim apricot trees.'
sen.cmt: The fool who > any who…is a fool.
sen.e: Anyone who prunes cherry trees is a fool, as is anyone who doesn't trim apricot trees.'

sen.j: 春先に咲く代表的な花であるサクラと梅のふたつを対比しつつ、栽培上の注意を示したもの。
sen.e: By comparing the cherry blossom, which is a representative flower in early spring and the Japanese plum, it shows cultivation precautions.
This expresses precautions about cultivation by comparing the Japanese plum, and cherry blossom, which is a representative flower of early Spring.
sen.cmt: it shows cultivation precautions > this expresses precations.
sen.e: This expresses precautions about cultivation by comparing the Japanese plum and cherry blossom, which are both representative flowers of early Spring.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: 桜はむやみに伐ると切り口から腐敗しがちであり、剪定には注意が必要。
sen.e: If cherry trees are cut unnecessarily, they become corrupt from the cut end surface and so pruning of them requires attention.
If cherry trees are cut unnecessarily, the cut surface can start to decay, so pruning of them requires care.
sen.cmt: curropt > start to decay. Attention > care.
sen.e: If cherry trees are cut unnecessarily, the cut surface can start to decay, so pruning of them requires care.

sen.j: 一方、梅の樹は剪定に強く、むしろかなり切り詰めないと徒枝が伸びて樹形が雑然となって台無しになるばかりでなく、実の付き方も悪くなる。
sen.e: On the other hand, Japanese plum trees are resistant to pruning and if they are trimmed considerably, their tree shape became scattered with their branches stooling and ripening of their fruits get spoiled.
On the other hand, Japanese plum trees are resistant to pruning and if they are not trimmed sufficiently, not only can their shape be ruined, ripening of fruit can be affected.
sen.cmt: trimmed considerably > not trimmed sufficiently. became scattered > not only can…be ruined. Spoiled > affected.
sen.e: On the other hand, Japanese plum trees are resistant to pruning and if they are not trimmed sufficiently, not only can their shape be ruined, ripening of fruit can be affected.

sen.j: 花芽は年々枝先へと移動する結果、実が付く枝は通常数年で枯れ込んでしまう。
sen.e: As the buds move to branches year by year, branches that produce fruits die in a few years.
As the buds move to the tips of the branches year on year, fruit-yielding branches generally die after a number of years.
sen.cmt: branches that produce fruits > fruit-yielding. In a few > after a number of.
sen.e: As the buds move to the tips of the branches year on year, fruit-yielding branches generally die after a number of years.

sen.j: 実の収穫を目的とするのであれば、定期的に枝の更新を図る必要があるからである。
sen.e: In order to harvest the fruits, regular renewal of branches is needed.
In order to harvest the fruits, regular renewal of branches is needed.
In order to harvest the fruits, regular renewal of branches is needed.

sen.j: 「東風〔こち〕吹かば にほひおこせよ梅の花 主なしとて 春な忘れそ」（菅原道真）
sen.e: When the wind is in the east, I want it to deliver the scent of Japanese plum flowers to me, even if I disappear from here, you, Japanese plum flowers, do not forget spring.
When the wind is in the east, I want it to blow the scent of Japanese plum flowers to me; even if I disappear from here, you, Japanese plum flowers, do not forget spring.' (SUGAWARA no Michizane)
When the wind is in the east, I want it to blow the scent of Japanese plum flowers to me; even if I disappear from here, you, Japanese plum flowers, do not forget spring.' (SUGAWARA no Michizane)

sen.j: 道真が大宰府に左遷されるとき、道真の愛した庭の梅の花に別れを惜しんで詠んだ歌。
sen.e: This is the Japanese poetry written when Michizane was demoted and transferred to Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region, parting reluctantly from his loved Japanese plum flowers in the garden.

This is a Japanese poem written when Michizane was demoted and transferred to Dazai-fu (local government office in the Kyushu region), parting reluctantly from the beloved Japanese plum flowers in his garden.

This is a Japanese poem written when Michizane was demoted and transferred to Dazaifu (local government office in the Kyushu region), parting reluctantly from the beloved Japanese plum flowers in his garden.
sen.cmt: 大宰府は今でもある地名なので、Dazaifuとしました。

sen.j: 後に庭の梅木が道真を追って大宰府に飛んできた、という「飛梅」がある。
sen.e: Later there was the legend of TOBIUME that the Japanese plum trees in the garden flied to Daszai-fu, following him.
Later there was a legend known as TOBIUME that the Japanese plum trees in the garden flew to Daszai-fu, following him.
Later there was a legend known as a flying plum tree (tobuume) that the Japanese plum trees in the garden flew to Daszaifu, following him.
sen.cmt: 飛梅に説明を補足しました。

sen.j: 「桃栗三年、柿八年、柚（ゆず）の馬鹿野郎十八年、梅はすいすい十六年」
sen.e: Peach and chestnut seeds take three years to bear fruit, plums take eight, Yuzu (Japanese citron) takes eighteen years and Japanese plum trees take sixteen years.'
Peach and chestnut seeds take three years to bear fruit, plums take eight, Yuzu (Japanese citron) takes eighteen years and Japanese plum trees take sixteen years.'
Peach and chestnut seeds take three years to bear fruit, plums take eight, Yuzu (Japanese citron) takes eighteen years and Japanese plum trees take sixteen years.'

sen.j: 種を植えてから実を収穫できるまでの期間を指す民謡。
sen.e: This is a Minyo (a traditional folk song) that shows periods from planting to harvesting of fruits.
This is a Minyo (a traditional folk song) that shows the time from planting to harvesting for various fruits.
This is a traditional folk song that shows the time from planting to harvesting for various fruits.

sen.j: 本来は「桃栗三年柿八年」で一つの諺。
sen.e: Originally 'peach and chestnut seeds take three years to bear fruit, plums take eight' is one proverb.
It originates from a single proverb 'Peach and chestnut seeds take three years to bear fruit, plums take eight.'
sen.cmt: originally..is one proverb > it originates from a single proverb
sen.e: It originates from a single proverb 'Peach and chestnut seeds take three years to bear fruit, plums take eight.'

sen.j: ｢物事は簡単にうまくいくものではなく、一人前になるには地道な努力と忍耐が必要だ」という教訓である。
sen.e: This is a lesson that things do not come easy and it often takes it often takes steady efforts and patience to become independent.
The moral is that things do not come easily and often it takes a steady effort and patience to achieve adulthood.
sen.cmt: it often takes it often takes > often it akes. Steady efforts > a steady effort. Become independent > achieve adulthood.
sen.e: The moral is that things do not come easily and often it takes a steady effort and patience to become full-fledged.
sen.cmt: 一人前の表現を変えました。

This park has around 1,200 Japanese plum trees on its 6.5-hectare site.
This park has around 1,200 Japanese plum trees on its 6.5-hectare site.

sen.j: 紅梅種と白梅種との比率は約6：4

The ratio of red plum blossoms to white plum blossoms is about 6 : 4.

sen.j: 日本三名園の一つ、また関東三大梅林の一つ

It is one of the three most outstanding gardens in Japan and of the three major Japanese plum gardens in the Kanto region.
It is one of the three most outstanding gardens in Japan and of the three major Japanese plum gardens in the Kanto region.
